data.title: The 45+ Best NBA Orlando Magic Shooting Guards
data.meta_description: Over 100 sports fans have voted on the 45+ Best NBA Orlando Magic Shooting Guards. Current Top 3: Tracy McGrady, Nick Anderson, Vince Carter
data.text:
Ranked By

1.1K votes

191 voters

3 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Orlando Magic

Big fan of Orlando basketball? Then check out this list of Orlando Magic shooting guards. It includes almost every shooting guard from throughout Orlando Magic history, including current shooting guards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA shooting guards of all time, the best Magic SGs include Nick Anderson, Tracy McGrady, Vince Carter, and Victor Oladipo.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Orlando Magic starting SGs and backup SGs are Gary Harris, Terrence Ross, R.J. Hampton, and E'Twaun Moore.

Who are the best shooting guards in Orlando Magic history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Orlando Magic shooting guard of all time!

Most divisive: DeShawn Stevenson

Over 100 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 45+ Best NBA Orlando Magic Shooting Guards

Birthplace : USA, Florida, Bartow

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Atlanta Hawks

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Orlando Magic: 2000–2004

A top-tier talent that graced the Orlando Magic roster during the early 2000s, Tracy McGrady joined the team as a free agent in 2000, forming a powerful partnership with Grant Hill. McGrady's offensive prowess combined with his defensive tenacity made him a force to be reckoned with throughout his tenure with Orlando. An instinctual scorer, he could create and execute plays in clutch moments, earning two NBA scoring titles in consecutive seasons (2002-2003, 2003-2004). Furthermore, T-Mac was a seven-time NBA All-Star, showcasing his immense impact on not just the Magic, but the entire league.

2

Nick Anderson

Age: 56

Birthplace : Chicago, Illinois

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Orlando Magic: 1989–1999

Joining the Orlando Magic as the team's first-ever draft pick in 1989, Nick Anderson quickly established himself as one of the franchise's foundational pieces. Known for his fearlessness and hard-nosed playing style, Anderson was an integral part of the dominant Magic teams of the mid-1990s, contributing significantly to their only NBA Finals appearance in 1995. While never racking up individual awards, his relentless dedication to winning made him a fan favorite, and he remains one of the most beloved figures in Orlando Magic history.

Birthplace : Daytona Beach, Florida

Nationality : American

Team : Toronto Raptors, New Jersey Nets, Orlando Magic, Phoenix Suns, Dallas Mavericks

Position : Small forward

Orlando Magic: 2009–2011

After years of making highlight reels with his high-flying dunks, Vince Carter was traded to the Orlando Magic in 2009, where he added much-needed veteran experience and leadership to a young squad. Carter's shooting ability complemented the playmaking of fellow All-Star Dwight Howard, helping propel the Magic to the Eastern Conference Finals during his very first season with the team. Though his stint with Orlando was brief, "Half-Man, Half-Amazing" left an indelible mark on the franchise and its fans.

Birthplace : Cookeville, Tennessee

Nationality : American

Team : Orlando Magic, Milwaukee Bucks, Los Angeles Clippers, Philadelphia 76ers, New Orleans Pelicans

Position : Shooting guard

Orlando Magic: 2006–2013

Selected 11th overall in the 2006 NBA Draft, J.J. Redick quickly carved out a niche for himself as one of the league's deadliest sharpshooters. During his time with the Orlando Magic, Redick's long-range precision helped spread the floor and create opportunities for his teammates. A fan favorite, he played an essential role in Orlando's deep playoff run in 2009. Redick's sharpshooting skills earned him the respect of the league and endeared him to Magic fans.

Birthplace : Atlanta, Georgia

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Shooting guard

Orlando Magic: 1996–1999

Joining the Orlando Magic as a free agent in 1996, Gerald Wilkins quickly became a key contributor off the bench. His slashing ability and mid-range shooting acumen provided the Magic with a valuable offensive weapon. Though only spending a short time with the organization, Wilkins' veteran presence and scoring punch made a significant impact on the team.

Birthplace : Saginaw, Michigan

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Orlando Magic

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Orlando Magic: 2010–2012

Acquired via trade in December 2010, Jason Richardson brought veteran savvy and scoring acumen to a young Orlando Magic squad. Known for his exceptional shooting range and leaping ability, he provided an instant offensive spark to the team. Although he only spent two seasons with the Magic, Richardson's experience and poise in clutch situations made a lasting impression on both the franchise and its fans.
